alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 12:17AM MST until July 26 at 3:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County from Pinedale to Heber in north central Arizona... * Until 315 AM MST. * At 1215 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along State Route 260 from Pinedale to Clay Springs to Heber. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clay Springs, Aripine, Pinedale, Fort Apache Reservation and Lewis Canyon Group Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 309 and 331. State Route 377 between mile markers 0 and 2. State Route 277 between mile markers 307 and 324. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Linden Draw, Day Wash, Decker Wash, Willow Wash, Show Low Creek, Turkey Canyon, Scott Wash, Dodson Wash, Phoenix Park Wash, Stinson Wash, Pierce Wash, Deer Springs Canyon, Jumpoff Canyon, Cottonwood Wash, Carrizo Creek, Pinedale Wash, West Fork Cottonwood Wash, Mud Creek and Black Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
